roleset.name: clean, make clear or open
roleset.note: CLEAR-V NOTES: Member of VNcls clear-10.3-1, preparing-26.3-1, other_cos-45.4, free-80-1. (from clear.01-v)

example.name: transitive
example.text: John cleared the crowded street.

example.name: with dirt
example.text: Inquiry clears Texas judge of bias in comments on homosexual murder victims.
example.arg: in comments on homosexual murder victims

example.name: Arg0,1
example.text: Kim's clearing the table after dinner was a part of her daily chores.

roleset.name: approve, permit
roleset.note: CLEAR-V NOTES: Comparison to 'approve'. No appropriate VN class. (from clear.02-v)
CLEARING-N NOTES: carefully compare to clearing.03 (from clearing.02-n)
CLEARANCE-N NOTES: Added due to expansion of Nombank. Comparison to 'permit'. See VN classes admit-65, allow-64, and order-60, and clear-10.3-1. No Fn class. Framed by Katie. (from clearance.01-n)

example.name: just plain transitive
example.text: A.L. Williams Corp. was merged into Primerica Corp., New York, after a special meeting of Williams shareholders cleared the transaction, the companies said.
example.arg: a special meeting of Williams shareholders

example.name: clear the way
example.text: In a surprise move, the British government cleared the way for a bidding war for Jaguar PLC by agreeing to remove an obstacle to a takeover of the auto maker.
example.arg: for a bidding war for Jaguar PLC
by agreeing to remove an obstacle to a takeover of the auto maker

example.name: passive extraction
example.text: [Dime Savings Bank of New York]-1 was cleared *trace*-1 by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp. to acquire Starpointe Savings Bank of Somerset, N.J., the banks said.
example.arg: by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp.
to acquire Starpointe Savings Bank of Somerset, N.J.,

example.name: Arg0,1
example.text: The shareholders' clearing the transaction was the only thing remaining before it was finalized.

example.name: straightforward example with arg 0 and 1
example.text: Cray Research Inc won government clearance for its proposed reorganization

example.name: arg 0 in PP
example.text: The clearance by the Food and Drug administration
example.arg: by the FOod and Drug administration

example.name: arg 0 and 1
example.text: Federal regulatory clearance for US distribution

example.name: arg 3 first
example.text: Their clearance by the Food and Drug administration
example.arg: by the Food and Drug administration

roleset.name: escape, avoid, get past or through
roleset.note: CLEAR-V NOTES: What's interesting about this roleset is that it's the exact oppositeof the 'approve' roleset; you could also say 'the Senate cleared thecompromise'. Disambiguation machines are going to have a fit over this. (from clear.03-v)
CLEARING-N NOTES: carefully compare to clearing.02 (from clearing.03-n)

example.name: transitive
example.text: [The compromise plan, which boosts the minimum wage for the first time since 1981,]-1 is expected *trace*-1 to clear the Senate soon.

example.name: Arg0,1
example.text: The bill's clearing the Senate was only the first step.

roleset.name: apparent, obvious, well-explained
roleset.note: CLEAR-J NOTES: Roleset based on insances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. Relation to clarify.01, which is member of other_cos-45.4. (from clear.01-j)

example.name: With It EXP
example.text: After last night 's events in Brussels , it 's clear that the UK does n't want to be a part of the Europe -LRB- or just the EU ? -RRB- anymore .
example.arg: After last night 's events in Brussels ,
that the UK does n't want to be a part of the Europe -LRB- or just the EU ? -RRB- anymore .

example.name: All args, analysis makes clear
example.text: It is clear to me from the analysis.

example.name: arg2 as subject
example.text: If the student was clear about who of the two was older , he could simply answered who was older , he could also answer who was superior in rank and that would be alright too , certainly , answering the question in terms of their strength and magical ability would also be accepted as correct .
example.arg: about who of the two was older

roleset.name: translucent
roleset.note: CLEAR-J NOTES: Roleset based on insances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. (from clear.04-j)

example.name: Girl's best friend
example.text: The diamond is perfectly clear.

roleset.name: unobstructed, clean, open
roleset.note: CLEAR-J NOTES: Roleset based on insances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. Based on verb entry clear.01, but differs from verb in that it lacks an arg0, which doesn't seem to be grammatical with the adjective. (from clear.02-j)

example.name: All args
example.text: When the rains came the area was clear of oil.

example.name: similar example
example.text: Make sure the area is clear of wires before working near trees or shrubs.

roleset.name: having avoided obstruction
roleset.note: CLEAR-J NOTES: Roleset based on insances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. (from clear.03-j)

example.name: All args
example.text: The ship was clear of the reef.

roleset.name: become/make clear, clean, becoming, making clean or clear
roleset.note: CLEAR_UP-V NOTES: Essentially the same as the 'clean' roleset. See VNcls clear-10.3-1. (from clear.04-v)

example.name: clear up my acne?
example.text: But it is puzzling to some Hollywood executives that Sony-1 rushed to hire them without *trace*-1 clearing up the Warner situation first.

example.name: Arg0,1
example.text: Her clearing up the rumors did not succeed in deflecting attention from her, and paparazzi continued to follow her every move.

roleset.name: remove, leave
roleset.note: CLEAR_OUT-V NOTES: Based on Bolt data. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie. (from clear.05-v)

example.name: With causer and place left
example.text: [Police-1] moved in before daybreak and started [*-1]to clear out the camp

example.name: with arg 1
example.text: [Occupy Oakland-1] has been cleared [*-1]out

roleset.name: make clear(er)
roleset.note: CLARIFY-V NOTES: Based on financial subcorpus. Member of VNcls other_cos-45.4. Updated by Julia, 11/2010. (from clarify.01-v)
CLARIFICATION-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry clarify.01, OntoNotes grouping clarification-n senses 1& 2; no mapping to VN. Framed by Claire. (from clarification.01-n)

example.name: transitive
example.text: As the London trading session drew to a close, the market was still listening to the parliamentary debate on the economy, with [new Chancellor of the Exchequer John Major]-1 expected *trace*-1 to clarify his approach to the British economy and currency issues.
example.arg: his approach to the British economy and currency issues

example.name: with benefactive
example.text: Mary clarified her reasons to John using very short words.

example.name: ergative, physical clarification
example.text: I am a fairly decent cook, though I have not really tackled complex tasks like the baking of bread or dramatic sauces which threaten to erupt into flames if you leave them anywhere near the stove after the butter clarifies.

example.name: Args 0 & 1
example.text: PLO leader Arafat asked Egypt to seek clarifications from theU.S. on Secretary of State Baker 's plan for Mideast peace talks.
example.arg: *ICH*-1 ---> on Secretary of State Baker 's plan for Mideast peace talks

example.name: Literal clarification
example.text: This recipe calls for the clarification of a cup of butter.

example.name: All arguments
example.text: His clarification of the term "wounded students" to at risk students puts a different light on strategies that are needed in schools.
